patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I have burning acid reflux, bleeding gums, and am always thirsty.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Stomach Fire is flaring upward. We must Clear Fire and Direct Qi Downward. Use cooling herbs.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I only get reflux when I'm angry or stressed. Bitter taste.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: The Liver (Wood) is pushing sideways into the Stomach (Earth). Clear Liver Heat to save the Stomach.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I burp up clear watery fluid, and my stomach feels cold.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: This is NOT acid excess; it is fermentation from lack of heat. Do not use antacids (cold). Warm the stomach.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Dull burning ache, dry mouth, no appetite. My tongue is peeled.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: The stomach lining (Yin) is dried out. We must 'Generate Fluids'. Avoid spicy/drying foods.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Dull ache that feels better when I press on it. Tired.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Deficiency pain likes pressure. The Stomach needs tonification, not clearing.
pharmacopeia: Xiang Sha Liu Jun Zi Tang

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Stabbing sharp pain in one spot. My stool is black/tarry.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Sharp fixed pain = Stasis. Black stool = Old bleeding. We must Stop Bleeding and Heal Tissue.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'The pain goes away when I eat or use a heating pad.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: The cold is preventing healing. Warmth promotes circulation to the ulcer site.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I have been hiccuping for 2 days non-stop.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: The Stomach Qi is rushing up instead of down. We must strongly Descend Qi and relax the diaphragm.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I feel dizzy, nauseous, and have a greasy taste in my mouth.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Phlegm is blocking the middle. The stomach cannot descend. We must Resolve Phlegm to settle the stomach.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I have zero desire to eat. I get full after two bites.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: The Spleen is asleep. We must 'Wake Up' the Spleen gently. Heavy tonics will clog it further.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'My child won't eat, has a swollen belly, and bad breath.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: The child is full of old food. Do not force feed. Clear the Stagnation first.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Sudden severe cramping pain after eating ice cream/cold wind.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Cold contracts the stomach muscles. We need immediate Heat (Moxa) to relax the spasm.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I burp loud and long, and it makes me feel relieved.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: The burping is a release of pressure (Qi Stagnation). Smooth the Qi mechanism.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Food feels like a rock. I hate the smell of food.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Use enzymatic herbs (Hawthorn, Malt) to mechanically break down the food mass.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I am pregnant and vomit every morning.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: The Chong Mai is destabilizing the Stomach. Harmonize the vessels gently (protect the fetus).
pharmacopeia: Xiang Sha Liu Jun Zi Tang

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I get sick in cars/boats easily.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Phlegm in the inner ear/stomach vibrates with motion. Stabilize the stomach before travel.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I have the stomach bacteria H. Pylori.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: This is a 'Toxic Damp-Heat' pathogen. We need herbs with antibiotic properties (Huang Lian).

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Food feels stuck in my throat when I swallow.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: If structural issues are ruled out, this is Phlegm-Qi blocking the esophagus.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Vomiting and diarrhea suddenly, chills.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: External Damp-Cold has invaded. We must release the exterior and transform dampness.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I feel hungry all the time but lose appetite when I eat.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Stomach Heat mimics hunger (burns food fast), but the Spleen is weak.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'My breath smells foul/hot.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Heat is rotting fluid in the stomach. We must drain the Fire downward.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Pain around the belly button, very cold.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: The umbilicus is the 'Shenque'. Cold here stops all circulation. Salt Moxa is best.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Sharp pain in lower right abdomen, hurts when you let go.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: This indicates severe Stasis/Infection (Appendicitis). Refer to ER. Treat Stasis/Heat if chronic.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'My stomach feels like it is dropping into my pelvis.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: The lifting energy is gone. We need to raise the visceral organs.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'I retch but nothing comes out. Dry throat.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: There are no fluids to vomit. Nourish Yin to settle the rebellion.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Constant sour taste.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Sour belongs to Wood (Liver). It is overflowing into Earth. Clear Liver Heat.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Constant sweet/sticky taste.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Sweet belongs to Earth (Spleen). Dampness is steaming upward. Transform Damp.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Taste like pennies/metal.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Metal belongs to Lung/LI. Heat is in the Yangming channel.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Food tastes like nothing.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: The Spleen opens to the mouth. If Spleen Qi is weak, taste is lost.

patient_qa_concern: Patient: 'Painful spasms in chest/throat when eating.'
therapist_strategy_deep_thinking: Strategy: Spasms are 'Wind/Qi Stagnation'. Relax the chest and smooth Qi.
